messages.messageBody:
***My post got longer and longer and longer (oops!), so I figured I'd
send it on to Helen (HEM) just for kicks. ***


Well, dang. I better renew my subscription. I let it go because I was
confident I could read Sandra's articles on her website. Now there's you
and Ren, bunch of show off writer types making me resubscribe...

Deb

"When we try to pick out anything by itself, we find it hitched to
everything else in the universe."
~John Muir~

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]  stages/levels of unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry---can t seem to find the title of this totally wonderful thread! I ve saved and printed several posts: Sandra & Sylvia & Deb & PamL-----maybe another two
messages.messageBody:
Sorry---can't seem to find the title of this totally wonderful thread!

I've saved and printed several posts: Sandra & Sylvia & Deb & PamL-----maybe
another two or three as well.

As Sandra said: this has really had me thinking lately. I'd planned to write
a little here before it took off. My post got longer and longer and longer
(oops!), so I figured I'd send it on to Helen (HEM) just for kicks. If she
doesn't want it, I'll make y'all suffer instead! <g>

I DO think that AlwaysLearning is the list for "thems that's already got
it"----and BOY! Can you tell it with these last two digests! Inspiring!

Thanks for some awesome posts!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
